definition: abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Amen bro, your IPAD will be $1000 next year.
sentences.chinese: 阿門，兄弟，明年你的IPAD就要1000美元了。

sentences.english: In your name we pray, Amen.
By him, and in him, all the promises of God are yea and amen.
sentences.chinese: 由他和他的，所有的承諾上帝是高雅和阿門。

sentences.english: God, hope their pitiful boyfriends can't hear that.
sentences.chinese: 阿門，但願大家的男朋友不要聽見。

sentences.english: Amen is transliterated from Hebrew into both Greek and English.
sentences.chinese: 阿門是譯音，從希伯來語到兩臺希臘語和英語。

sentences.english: Make me be the person You want me to be. Amen.
sentences.chinese: 請控制我的生活，變我爲你所想，阿門。

sentences.english: My lord, forgive all these sinful sinners , amen.
sentences.chinese: 主啊，饒恕這些災難深重的人吧，阿門。

sentences.english: May god grant you a happy life partner, amen.
sentences.chinese: 願上帝賜予你一個幸福的終身伴侶，阿門。

definition: erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
Get well soon!/to recover health quickly
to open one's eyes/to widen one's horizons
to have a close call/to have a narrow escape
to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
to talk drivel/to make irresponsible remarks
